file_content.text: Thanks again. Maybe I can get out of here without worrying about where I step.
Nerves of durasteel. I could feel those detonations from here.
Oh, we located the bomber we shot down; they were shipping in supplies. I think you've earned first pick, don't you?
You look like everything's still attached. The detonations must be going well.
Oh no. Don't tell me someone set those things off. No, can't be that--you're still in one piece.
Sorry--be careful when you leave, Master Jedi. There's unexploded bombs outside.
Sorry, sir. We've got unexploded ordnance outside. Hardly ZR-57s, but nasty hardware all the same.
Take my advice: When you go outside, walk close together. We've got unexploded bombs close by.
Take my advice: Watch your step outside. We've got unexploded bombs nearby.
Our AA guns winged an Imperial bomber, and it dropped its payload as it crashed. Too low to set the bombs off, but sooner or later, something will.
You should have this area cordoned off until the bombs are dealt with. It's not worth risking lives.
Then keep people away.
No good, Master Jedi. This is a major staging zone; we need the streets open.
We need to remember this situation could have been a lot worse.
At least their target is safe.
You're telling me. That bomber was heading straight for a residential district.
You can't leave live ordnance lying around; call in a bomb squad and have them cleared.
So get them disarmed.
Wish it was that easy, sir, but the Empire's bombed the whole city. We're low on the list.
These bombs can't be that sensitive. Can they?
Like what?
Let me put it this way. If you get the urge to sneeze, don't.
Give me a worst-case scenario.
If they all went off right here, those bombs could ignite the underground gas conduits. Half the city would be in flames.
But you haven't evacuated.
Where am I going to go? At least here I know exactly where the danger is.
We set up a safe area for controlled detonations, but getting the bombs there is easier said than done.
Just moving the bombs will start their countdown. If they go off while someone's holding them, well, it's not going to be pretty.
I'll help. I'm not afraid.
You're absolutely, completely sure? I won't turn away help.
What's the countdown on the bombs?
How long will I have?
Um. That's a good question. But if you do it fast, there's no problems, right?
Just take the bombs to the detonation area--very, very carefully. We've got ground emitters there to contain the blast.
Thanks for this. And don't take any chances with those things. Who knows what the Empire's been cooking up.
So handle it. [Refuse quest]
I suppose I'll try asking among my men for volunteers. Again.
I keep waiting for that "bang" in the distance.
